translation: Your right is only to work, but not to its results; do not let the results of action be your motive, nor let your attachment be to inaction.
commentary: 2.47 in action in work? Eve only? Right: right? And thy? Ma not? in the fruits in the fruits? Never at any time? Ma not? Karmaphalahetuḥ bhūḥ let not the fruits of action be thy motive? Ma not? And thy? Sangah attachment? So let (there) be? Akarmani in inaction.Commentary When you perform actions have no desire for the fruits thereof under any circumstances. If you thirst for the fruits of your actions? you will
